item.title: Rich: Enrich your CSVs with new columns
item.description: This week a fellow B12er was performing an ad-hoc data analysis. They had a spreadsheet with some data, and wanted to classify the rows in the spreadsheet by a few different criteria along which they would look for trends. For an engineer, this would have been a quick Python script wrapping some classifier (in our case, the OpenAI API), but there wasn‚Äôt an engineer available for the project. We looked at some third-party plugins for Google Sheets, but it wasn‚Äôt clear what sorts of guarantees they made around data privacy, and we didn‚Äôt feel comfortable installing them. So, with some help from OpenAI‚Äôs o3, I created Rich, an OpenAI-powered CSV data enricher that‚Äôs a fully client-side single-page application.

item.title: 10X Your AI Code Output: The Context Strategy That Beats Outdated LLM Knowledge.
item.description: Tired of AI coders tripping on new libraries? MadKudu's CTO reveals how feeding targeted context (think Context7) to your LLM can dramatically boost accuracy and 10x your AI-assisted coding. Stop fighting outdated knowledge!

item.title: A SomewhatMaxSAT Solver
item.description: As you may recall from previous posts and elsewhere I have been busy writing a new solver for APT. Today I want to share some of the latest changes in how to approach solving. The idea for the solver was that manually installed packages are always protected from removals ‚Äì in terms of SAT solving, they are facts. Automatically installed packages become optional unit clauses. Optional clauses are solved after manual ones, they don‚Äôt partake in normal unit propagation.

item.title: Scaling Starts with Simplicity
item.description: In small to mid-sized engineering teams, unchecked diversity in backend technology stacks can lead to increased cognitive load, fragmented knowledge, and reduced team mobility. While each language or tool may offer individual advantages, the lack of alignment often results in duplicated efforts, inconsistent practices, and slower progress

item.title: One Week of Full-Time Indie Game Development
item.description:
Devlog video about "HomeGrown", the casual farming game I'm creating using my own engine.
Support the channel on Patreon and get access to the game & code for Homegrown, the city-builder, and Equilinox: https://www.patreon.com/thinmatrix
Play my previous game "Equilinox": https://store.steampowered.com/app/853550/Equilinox/
Follow the game's progress on my social media: Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thinmatrix/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/ThinMatrix Bluesky: https://bsky.app/profile/thinmatrix.bsky.social Trello: https://trello.com/b/W3zkIJTM/farm Email: thinmatrix@gmail.com
